ESRI.Configuration.Name: Relative Difference in Contrast Heatmap
ESRI.Configuration.Description: Highlight cells with significant change based on relative difference in contrast between two overlapping rasters. Find outlier cells in a single raster. Heatmap is colored based on 1,2,3 standard deviations away from the mean.
ESRI.Configuration.Author: ansonl

ComboBox.caption: Index Method
ComboBox.message: Select an index method apply to rasters before calculating r.d.c.
ComboBox.tip: Index method to apply for analysis

ComboBox.caption: Imagelet Size
ComboBox.message: Select 0 to not split up user defined extent into imagelets.\n Select or Type an imagelet square side length to break up user defined area for highlighting significant r.d.c. on localized square areas.
ComboBox.tip: Imagelet Size for localized area analysis

ComboBox.caption: Analyze single raster
ComboBox.message: Use Raster 1 for calculations and ignore Raster 2

Button.caption: Select Raster 1
Button.message: Select Raster 1 for relative difference in contrast calculation

Button.caption: Select Raster 2
Button.message: Select Raster 2 for relative difference in contrast calculation

Tool.caption: Define extent and create heatmap
Tool.message: Select a rectangular area to apply index method to and highlight cells with significant relative difference in contrast based on 1,2,3 standard deviations from mean.
Tool.tip: Highlight Significant Relative Difference in Contrast (r.d.c.)

Button.caption: Remove Background
Button.message: Replace 0 value background cells of a raster with NODATA value
